Sun of Faith - English: Chapter 13. The Bodhisattva Takes Gopa as Queen
The Shakya youths got in their carriages and returned to Kapilavastu.
Manual - English: At the roof of a mansion, Gopā (sa mtsho ma) sees the Buddha. With the big toe of her one foot, she causes a hole on the roof. The Buddha, in a carriage, sees Gopā when the iron arrow breaks into pieces in his hand.  In a mansion, he takes Gopā as his bride.

Sun of Faith - English: The soothsayers predicted, "If the youth Siddartha does not renounce the world in seven years he will become a universal monarch."
At that time, the Bodhisattva saw Shakya Ghantaghosha's daughter Gopa, a jewel among women, gazing from her balcony.
The Bodhisattva halted the carriage with his toe. The drivers were not able to control the horses and the carriage was unable to move.
Scene working notes: The Vinayavastu passage does not mention the "strenous efforts" of the horses and coachman but just says that the vehicle wouldn't budge: "shing rta mnan nas mi g.yo bar gyur pa"

Sun of Faith - English: As the Bodhisattva beheld Gopa, he reduced the iron arrow he held in his hand to dust.
Gopa also beheld the Bodhisattva. She was unable to move, and the big toe of her foot pressed into the balcony floor causing the balcony to crumble.
A great crowd of people saw this and said, "This girl is well suited to the youth's affections."
King Shuddhodana heard this account and invited Devi Gopa and her retinue of twenty thousand to become the Bodhisattva's wives.
Inscription - English: Gopa is taken as a wife
